'''''Other Hands'' 29/30''' is a double-issue of ''[[Other Hands]]'', a magazine devoted to ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing|MERP]]''. The theme of the issue is "Southern Middle-earth"

* '''Published:''' July [[2000]]
*'''ISSN:''' 1081-8359
*'''Editing:''' Martin Burke, James P. Garriss, Jr., [[Chris Seeman]], Charles Watteyne
*'''Linguistics:''' Christian Hass, [[David Salo]]
*'''Graphic design:''' Quentin Westcott
*'''Artwork:''' Clovis Fajardo, Quentin Westcott
*'''Maps:''' [[Bridget Buxton]], Eric Dubourg, Wesley J. Frank, [[Thomas Morwinsky]], [[Chris Seeman]]

==Contents==
''Article name - (Author's name) [Publisher's notes]''

*Editorial - ([[Chris Seeman]]) [2 pgs]
*Magic Feature: Words of Command - (Andy Mack) [concrete game mechanics for WoCs; 3 pgs]
*An Alternative Continental Map for MERP - ([[Thomas Morwinsky]]) [notes on the design of the new Endor continent map; 2 pgs + map insert]
*The MÃ»makanril - (Christian Haas) [cultural background, gazetteer, and development stats; 9 pgs + map insert]
*Mithril Feature: The Mirror of Fire - ([[Chris Seeman]]) [2 pgs]
*The Sisters of Ishtra - (Cory Rushton) [background and stats for a southron religious order; 4 pgs]
*Supplement: The Realm of Bellakar - (Eric Dubourg) [history for a completely new realm in southern Middle-earth; 56 pgs + map insert]
